# Assembly

I tried to solve the following problem with a code snippet on [Quora](https://www.quora.com/How-do-you-print-100-times-your-name-using-a-code-snippet): *How do you print 100 times your name using a code snippet?* I solved it using C and Haskell, then I tried to use my assemly knowledge to solve it. Despite the fact that my assemly is far from perfect, it was enough to solve it though. For running it on  a Linux machine run:

`nasm file_name.nasm` 

The output is file named *file_name.o*.

Then run:

`ld file_name file_name.o`

If you want to print the string "MyName" the output should look like this:

``

It was compiled and tested by *NASM version 2.14.02*.
